name: renewably
content:

If something, especially energy, is produced renewably, it can be produced as quickly as it is used: For the first time, more than 50% of the country's energy was supplied from renewably generated sources such as solar and wind power. They claim that geothermal power can cleanly and renewably meet the region's electricity demand.
More examplesFewer examplesAll of our furniture is made from renewably sourced wood.She set out her vision for a renewably powered world.The majority of biomass fuel is harvested renewably from trees and shrubs.
